pros: Decent enough pay, considering how much other jobs on campus pay.

pros: This job was very flexible with great coworkers and a great boss. I was able to learn while I worked and get to know equipment and software more.

pros: The atmosphere here is really supportive and the flexible hours and variety of writing jobs makes it engaging and easy to keep up with while balancing classwork.

pros: Easy work for the most part. You can often work on class projects and do homework on your long shifts. You learn how to solve problems when you have to figure out why software isn't working for the students.
cons: Can be a lot of lifting, carrying, etc. in the height of narrative production. Pay is absolutely minimal. Not always clear what needs to be done, what equipment goes where.

review_title: A great employer for someone working as a student at Taylor - both understanding and fair payment for time worked.
pros: Great people to work with, a Christian environment, a wonderful community of friends within work, and fairly treated.
cons: While the hours as a Student Sound Technician varied, they were not the best to work around for social and academic needs.

pros: Taylor provides knowledgeable and caring professors, that seek to encourage and sustain the growth of its students. Taylor's small and caring community fosters growth of its students and faculty. The university seeks out academic excellence.
cons: Taylor's community, like many universities, can become overbearing and can sometimes expect too much of students. This can lead to students being overcommitted, and can become burnt out in their time at Taylor.

pros: Flexible hours, great culture and environment, fun people. It's a great place to work, and my front desk job was perfect for me as a student.
cons: I have no complaints, it's a great place to work. You get paid minimum wage and there aren't any chances for career advancement, but that's not a problem if you're a student.

review_title: And they say DisneyWorld is the most magical place on earth...
pros: Excellent office community, flexibility for student schedules, hones a multitude of important skills (public speaking, interpersonal communication, phone systems, exposure to Salesforce CRM
cons: Not many hours available for students (4-7 per week) and can be unrewarding at times

pros: Taylor U. Wellness Coach offers flexible schedule and the opportunity to build and demonstrate clinical knowledge of exercise science curriculum along with building meaningful relationships with clients.
cons: Entry level position so wages are not the best.

pros: As a GA my supervisor left me plenty of time to do a good job on my assignments for school.
cons: I had to ask to do some things I wanted to do as a way of gaining real world experience necessary for the job hunt.

review_title: Working at Taylor has been a highlight of my career. A community of top level professors and staff.
pros: Great place to work and develop.
cons: Long commute and the winters are hard.
